batalha-monastery.title: Batalha Monastery
batalha-monastery.description: The Monastery of Batalha, is a Dominican convent in the civil parish of Batalha, in the Center Region region of Portugal. It was erected in commemoration of the 1385 Battle of Aljubarrota. It is one of the best and original examples of Late Gothic architecture in Portugal, intermingled with the Manueline style. It is listed as UNESCO World Heritage site.

bones-chapel-of-the-st-francisco-church.title: Bones Chapel of the St. Francisco Church

sintra-national-palace.title: Sintra National Palace
sintra-national-palace.description: The Sintra National Palace is located in the town of Sintra, Portugal. It is the best preserved medieval Royal Palace in Portugal, from being inhabited more or less continuously from at least the early 15th century to the late 19th century. It is an significant tourist attraction, and is part of the cultural landscape of Sintra, a designated UNESCO World Heritage Site.

chalet-of-the-countess-of-edla.title: Chalet of the Countess of Edla

castle-of-st-george.title: Castle of St. George
castle-of-st-george.description: The Castle of São Jorge is a Moorish castle occupying a commanding hilltop overlooking the historic centre of the Portuguese city of Lisbon and Tagus River. The strongly fortified citadel dates from medieval period of Portuguese history, and is one of the main tourist sites of Lisbon.

gardens-and-the-tower-of-belem.title: Gardens and the Tower of Belém
gardens-and-the-tower-of-belem.description: The Garden of the Belem Tower is a garden located in Lisbon, next to the Belém Tower, which was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983.

mafra-national-palace.title: Mafra National Palace
mafra-national-palace.description: The Mafra National Palace is a monumental Baroque and Italianized Neoclassical palace-monastery located in Mafra, Portugal. Construction began in 1717 and was completely concluded in 1755. The palace was classified as a National Monument in 1910.

queluz-national-palace.title: Queluz National Palace
queluz-national-palace.description: The Queluz National Palace is a Portuguese 18th-century palace located at Queluz, in Sintra, Portugal. One of the last great Rococo buildings to be designed in Europe, the palace was conceived as a summer retreat for Dom Pedro of Braganza, later to become husband and then king consort to his own niece, Queen Maria I. The work on the palace began in 1747, by order of the King D. Pedro III.

cathedral-of-braga.title: Cathedral of Braga
cathedral-of-braga.description: The Cathedral of Braga is one of the most important monuments in the city of Braga, in Northern Portugal. Due to its long history and artistic significance it is also one of the most important buildings in the country. It from the 3rd century AD, being one of the oldest in the Iberian Peninsula.

castle-of-monsaraz.title: Castle of Monsaraz
castle-of-monsaraz.description: Castelo de Monsaraz is a Castle located in the region of Evora, in Portugal. It is classified as a National Monument.

national-palace-of-pena.title: National Palace of Pena
national-palace-of-pena.description: The Pena National Palace is a Romanticist palace in Sintra, Portugal. It is a national monument and constitutes one of the major expressions of 19th-century Romanticism in the world. The palace is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the Seven Wonders of Portugal.

cabo-da-roca.title: Cabo da Roca
cabo-da-roca.description: Cabo da Roca (Cape Roca) is a cape which forms the westernmost extent of mainland Portugal and continental Europe. The cape is in the Portuguese municipality of Sintra, in the southwest of the district of Lisbon, forming the westernmost extent of the Serra de Sintra.

castle-of-guimaraes.title: Castle of Guimarães
castle-of-guimaraes.description: The Castle of Guimarães, is located in the northern region of Portugal. It was ordered constructed by D. Mumadona Dias in the 10th century in order to defend its monastery from attacks by Moors and Norman.The castle and the city of Guimarães are associated with the origins of the Portuguese nation. It's commonly know as the ""Cradle of Portugal".

palace-of-the-dukes-of-braganza.title: Palace of the Dukes of Braganza
palace-of-the-dukes-of-braganza.description: The Palace of the Dukes of Braganza, is a medieval estate and former residence of the first Dukes of Braganza, located in the historical centre of Guimarães, in the north-western part of Portugal. The residence was ordered to be built in the first quarter of the 15th century (likely 1420 to 1422).

conimbriga-ruins.title: Conímbriga Ruins
conimbriga-ruins.description: Conímbriga is one of the largest Roman settlements excavated in Portugal, and was classified as a National Monument in 1910. It's Located in Condeixa-a-Velha, Coimbra. Conímbriga is a walled urban settlement, encircled by a curtain of stone structures approximately 1,500 metres (4,900 ft) long.

jeronimos-monastery.title: Jeronimos Monastery
jeronimos-monastery.description: The Jerónimos Monastery or Hieronymites Monastery, is a monastery of the Order of Saint Jerome located near the shore of the parish of Belém, in the Lisbon Municipality, Portugal. The monastery is one of the most prominent examples of the Portuguese Late Gothic Manueline style of architecture in Lisbon. It was classified a UNESCO World Heritage Site, along with the nearby Tower of Belém, in 1983.

alcobaca-monastery.title: Alcobaça Monastery
alcobaca-monastery.description: The Alcobaça Monastery is a Medieval Roman Catholic monastery located in the town of Alcobaça, in Oeste Subregion. It was founded by the first Portuguese King, Afonso Henriques, in 1153, and maintained a close association with the Kings of Portugal throughout its history. Due to its artistic and historical importance, it was listed by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site in 1989.

obidos.title: Óbidos
obidos.description: Óbidos is a picturesque fortified town and a municipality in the Oeste Subregion of Portugal. The town has approximately 3100 inhabitants. The municipality population in 2011 was 11,772, in an area of 141.55 km². In 2007 the town was listed as one of the 7 Wonders of Portugal.

serra-da-estrela-natural-park.title: Serra da Estrela Natural Park
serra-da-estrela-natural-park.description: Serra da Estrela Natural Park is situated in the largest mountain range in Portugal - the Serra da Estrela, and is the source of the rivers Mondego, Zêzere (tributary of the Tagus), and Alva. The park is the largest natural conservation area in Portugal and occupies about 1,000 km².

monserrate-palace.title: Monserrate Palace
monserrate-palace.description: The Monserrate Palace is an exotic palatial villa located near Sintra, Portugal, the traditional summer resort of the Portuguese court. It was restored in 1858 for Sir Francis Cook, an English baronet created visconde de Monserrate by King Luís. Monserrate turned to an English architect, James Knowles Jr., for designs.

nations-park.title: Nations Park
nations-park.description: Parque das Nações is a parish of the city of Lisbon, Portugal. It's a remarcable leisure, commercial, and residential area since the 1998 World Exposition, formerly used for mainly industrial purposes. The area underwent a tremendous transformation in the 1990s, when it was chosen as the location for the World Exhibition.

lisbon-oceanarium.title: Lisbon Oceanarium
lisbon-oceanarium.description: The Lisbon Oceanarium is an oceanarium in Lisbon, Portugal. It is located in the Parque das Nações, which was the exhibition grounds for the Expo '98. It is the largest indoor aquarium in Europe.

sport-lisboa-e-benfica-stadium.title: Sport Lisboa e Benfica Stadium
sport-lisboa-e-benfica-stadium.description: Estádio da Luz officially named Estádio do Sport Lisboa e Benfica, is a multi-purpose stadium located in Lisbon, Portugal. The stadium is used mostly for football matches, hosting the home matches of S.L. Benfica. The stadium, has a 66.000 seat capacity. It hosted the final of Euro2004 and the 2014 Champions League Final, and the ceremony for the 7 New Wonders of the World, in 2007.

douro-international-natural-park.title: Douro International Natural Park
douro-international-natural-park.description: The International Douro Natural Park is one of the thirteen natural parks of Portugal. It is located in the municipalities of Miranda do Douro, Mogadouro, Freixo de Espada à Cinta and Figueira de Castelo Rodrigo, spanning a lengthy area along the Douro River where it functions as the border between Portugal and Spain (hence "International Douro"). The park also goes includes the border area of the Águeda River. The park was created to protect the scenic landscape of the region, as well as its flora and fauna.

panteao-nacional-igreja-de-santa-engraci.title: Panteão Nacional - Igreja de Santa Engrácia

reserva-natural-local-do-estuario-do-dou.title: Reserva Natural Local Do Estuario Do Douro

praca-de-touros-do-campo-pequeno.title: Praça de Touros do Campo Pequeno
